text: Habakkuk
Habakkuk’s Complaint
The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet saw.
O Yahweh, how long shall I cry for help
and you will not listen?
\add How long\add* will I cry out to you, “Violence!”
and you will not save?
Why do you cause me to see evil
\add while\add* you look at trouble?
Destruction and violence happen before me;
contention and strife arise.
Therefore the law is paralyzed,
and justice does not go forth perpetually.\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Or “forever” \f*
For the wicked surround the righteous;
therefore justice goes forth perverted.
God’s Answer to Habakkuk
“Look among the nations and see;
be astonished and astounded.
For a work \add is about to\add* be done in your days
that you will not believe if it is told.
For look! I am raising up the Chaldeans,
the bitter and impetuous nation,
the one who walks through the spacious places of earth
to take possession of dwellings not belonging to it.\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Or “him” \f*
They\f + \fr 1:7 \ft Hebrew “He” \f* \add are\add* dreadful and awesome;
their\f + \fr 1:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* justice and their\f + \fr 1:7 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* dignity proceed from themselves.\f + \fr 1:7 \ft Hebrew “him” \f*
Their\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Hebrew “His” \f* horses \add are\add* more swift than leopards;
they are more menacing than wolves \add at\add* dusk.
Their\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Hebrew “His” \f* horsemen gallop; their\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* horsemen come from afar;
they fly like an eagle \add that is\add* swift to devour.
All of them\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* come for violence,
their faces pressing forward.
They gather captives like the sand.
And they themselves scoff at kings
and rulers \add are\add* a joke to them.
They laugh at every fortification,
and they heap up earth and take it.
Then they sweep \add like the\add* wind and pass on;
they become guilty, whose might \add is\add* their\f + \fr 1:11 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* god!”
Habakkuk’s Second Complaint
Are you not from of old,
O Yahweh my God, my Holy One?
You\f + \fr 1:12 \ft Hebrew “we shall not die,” considered a deliberate scribal change of the text to avoid offensive language toward Yahweh \f* shall not die.
O Yahweh, you have marked them\f + \fr 1:12 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* for judgment;
O Rock, you have established them\f + \fr 1:12 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* for reproof.
Your eyes \add are\add* too pure to see evil,
and you are not able to look at wrongdoing.\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Or “trouble” \f*
Why do you look at the treacherous?
\add Why\add* are you silent when the wicked swallows up
\add someone\add* more righteous than him?
You make humankind like fish of the sea,
like crawling creatures that have no ruler among them.
He brings up all of them with a fishhook;
he drags them up with a fishnet;
he gathers them in his dragnet.
Therefore, he rejoices and exults.
Therefore he sacrifices to his fishnet
and makes offerings to his dragnet,
for by them ⸤he makes a good living⸥\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Literally “his portion is fat” \f*
and his food \add is\add* rich.
Will he therefore empty his fishnet
and continually kill nations without showing mercy?
